result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Vinzant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Special disposition under 973.015 if succesfully completes probation, pays all court costs in full and completes community service.

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: per Leila @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
from defendant - will be in on 10/7/16 to pay - informed defendant that warrant status will remain
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

Case called:  8:42 am.:  Defendant Tyler J. Vinzant in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Jillian Pfeifer ADA appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lynch statement to court - an agreement reached - defendant to plead No Contest and be placed on Probation for 1 year and pay restitution of $1472.44 which  includes statutory 10% surcharge and if  successful completion of probation record may be expunged.     Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Atty Pfeifer states to court the victim has submitted a Victim Impatct Statement and provides to court - victim does not wish to speak but would like letter given to court.  Atty Lynch statement to court regarding possible expungement of case.  Court notes no prior criminal history.  Defendant makes statement to court.   Court will follow recommendations   The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).  Appeal Rights given.  Atty Pfiefer statement to court - states looking through case notes that the restitution should be more for a total of $1756.79.  Court statement to Atty Lynch - will give 30 days to file a request for restitution hearing if does not agree with total amountof restitution.

Court Sentence:
WHS
1 year POP
$1756.79 restitution - includes 10% surcharge
Court Costs of $443.00
Perform 20 hours of Community Service

Court will expunge if defendant successfully completes Probation, pays court costs and completes 20 hours of Community Service under State Statute 973.015

3:40 p.m. Defendant Tyler J. Vinzant in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant previously authorized. Lynch statement that he confirmed wrong date with Defendant - Lynch is confident close to resolution. Bail continued. Adj. 3:44 pm  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

1:44 p.m. Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Lynch expected defendant to be here - has had regular contact with him - still expect defendant to be here - may be close to resolution at this time - just needs to complete discussion with client. Schiek statement - agrees to adjourned pre-trial. Court authorizes warrant based on defendant's non-appearance. Adj. 1:47 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:38 p.m. Defendant Tyler J. Vinzant in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 3:40 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:27 p.m. Defendant Tyler J. Vinzant in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig  bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
